repnme.cdata!: Slovak Republic - Economic Recovery Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Economic Recovery
            Loan (ERL) of the Slovak Republic can be rated as partially
            satisfactory. The ERL supported the transformation of the
            Slovak economy and provided funds for imports when they were
            most needed. Being a small open economy, Slovakia can expect
            to grow at a moderate pace even if foreign markets absorb
            its exports at considerably lower rates than has recently
            been the case. Some of the lessons are as follows: First,
            the ERL was designed as a single tranche operation to give
            continuity to the ongoing reform program and to be a visible
            measure of international support to the new country. Second,
            the lack of appropriate institutions could be an important
            impediment to modernization and restructuring. Third, like
            in other Central and Eastern European countries, the ERL was
            broadly designed to support the transformation process.

5082323.majtheme: Economic management,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!: Slovak Republic - Economic Recovery Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Recovery Loan Project
            supports Slovakia's ongoing transformation by financing
            many of the one-off costs associated with restructuring and
            the break-up of the Czech and Slovak Federation. The loan
            will support the government's program of structural
            adjustment and the key reforms that contribute to the
            restoration of growth. The reforms focus on four areas: (a)
            fiscal retrenchment; (b) strengthening and diversifying the
            financial sector; (c) continued privatization, private
            sector development and enterprise restructuring; and (d) a
            more efficient social safety net.
